sentence.Network_en: Bulman was cursed with a poor memory for names.
sentence.Network_cn: 布尔曼总是记不住人名。

sentence.Network_en: Whitlock silently cursed Graham for heaping more suspicion on him.
sentence.Network_cn: 惠特洛克心里默默地诅咒格雷厄姆，因为他让自己备受猜疑。

sentence.Network_en: Grandma protested, but he cursed her and rudely pushed her aside.
sentence.Network_cn: 奶奶提出抗议，但他辱骂她并把她粗暴地推到一旁。

list.abs: 赢者的诅咒（winners curse），假设某一特定的土地（或其他商品及资产）存在很多种投标价格，且投标者们对土地价值的估计基本 …
“资源诅咒”(Resource Curse)是发展经济学中的一个著名命题,其基本理念是丰富的资源趋于阻碍而非促进经济发展。
贼_互动百科 ... 刺客,杀人的人【 murderer】 骂人的字眼【 curse word】 祸害【 calamity; disaster】.
包含骂的词语 | 常用词典 | 中华博物 ... ◆ 毒骂[  curse viciously ] ◆ 叫骂[ shout curses ] ◆ 滥骂[  scurrility ].

entry.def: If you are cursed with something, you are very unlucky in having it.

example.ex: Bulman was cursed with a poor memory for names.
example.tran: 布尔曼总是记不住人名。

entry.def: Someone or something that is cursed is suffering as the result of a curse.

example.tran: 全家人仿佛都受到了诅咒。

example.ex: The ground was cursed because of him.
example.tran: 大地因为他而遭受诅咒。

entry.tran: (尤用于生气时加强语气)该死的，可恶的
entry.def: Cursed is used by some people to emphasize what they are saying, especially when they are angry.

example.ex: I wish this cursed place was burned.
example.tran: 我希望这该死的地方被烧毁。

means.word_mean: 1. deserving a curse; sometimes used as an intensifier;

sentences.sentence: "villagers shun the area believing it to be cursed"
"I'll be cursed if I can see your reasoning"

means.word_mean: 2. in danger of the eternal punishment of hell;
